intro: Uvaria ambongoensis var. botulina, commonly known as the Botulina Uvaria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions in Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly rough texture. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
